title: Milky Way (Antarctica)
text: The Milky Way is a <a href="col">col</a> (a gap between two mountain peaks) situated between the southernmost extremity of the <a href="LeMay%20Range">LeMay Range</a> and the <a href="Planet%20Heights">Planet Heights</a> mountain range, in the eastern part of <a href="Alexander%20Island">Alexander Island</a>, <a href="Antarctica">Antarctica</a>. It is the highest point on a possible sledging route between <a href="Jupiter%20Glacier">Jupiter Glacier</a> and <a href="Uranus%20Glacier">Uranus Glacier</a>. The col was first mapped from air photos taken by the <a href="Ronne%20Antarctic%20Research%20Expedition">Ronne Antarctic Research Expedition</a> in 1947–48, by <a href="D.%20Searle">D. Searle</a> of the <a href="Falkland%20Islands%20Dependencies%20Survey">Falkland Islands Dependencies Survey</a> in 1960. It was named after the <a href="Milky%20Way">Milky Way</a> by the <a href="UK%20Antarctic%20Place-Names%20Committee">UK Antarctic Place-Names Committee</a> from association with the nearby Planet Heights and the glaciers which are named for the planets of the <a href="Solar%20System">Solar System</a>.
